com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server
Class ImapServer

java.lang.Object
  com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server.ImapServer

public class ImapServer
extends Object

Represents a IMAP server that can be accessed to retrieve messages. The Internet Message Access Protocol or IMAP is one of the two most prevalent Internet standard protocols for e-mail retrieval, the other being POP3. Virtually all modern e-mail clients and servers support both protocols as a means of transferring e-mail messages from a server, such as those used by Gmail, to a client, such as Mozilla Thunderbird, Apple Mail and Microsoft Outlook. Once configured, the client's use of such protocols remains transparent to the user.

Version:
1.00 2009-05-12 Initial submission., 1.10 2009-05-31 Added constructor debug, renamed openAndMonitor to startMonitoring() and made the method public. Updated for changes to the ConnectionInfo class.
Author:
rhaq

public static final long IDLE_TIME
The amount of time in milliseconds to delay before checking for new messages.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ImapServer

public ImapServer(ConnectionInfo info,
                  boolean debug)
           throws MessagingException
Creates an IMAP server using the connection information specified to be processed by the processor specified upon new requests that arrive at its default folder.

Parameters:
info - Information required to connect to the IMAP server.
debug - Should debug information be shown.
Throws:
MessagingException - In the event that the server could not authenticate the connection or the required folder(s) could not be opened/accessed.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws MessagingException
Closes the folder and store that the server is listening to in the host and ends the connection to the server as well as dereferencing pointers. Stops monitoring the server.

Throws:
MessagingException - If there are any problems ending the connection.
See Also:
Service.close()

startMonitoring

public void startMonitoring(MessageCountAdapter processor)
                     throws MessagingException,
                            InterruptedException
Opens the default folder where the mail is stored and monitors it for new messages that have not been processed.

Parameters:
processor - Responsible for reacting to new message request events.
Throws:
MessagingException - If the folder being checked does not respond or is closed and thus access is not allowed.
InterruptedException - If this thread is interrupted while delaying before the next check for new messages.
